TopicTitle: [1.2.1] Outer Planets Mod (2.1) - Active development has moved, see first post for new thread

Articles.Content: How do i install this mod?
Could you post a screenshot of your GameData folder? Might help us find what's wrong.

Is anyone experiencing phantom crashes with OPM? The game just crashes all of a sudden, no warning whatsoever. I have more than enough memory so that's not the problem.

edit:

It seems KSP itself was out of its own memory when OPM is installed. I've lowered the textures to half resolution and that seems to have solved the problem.

Edited June 1, 2015 by lajoswinkler
Just a quick question captrobau, are there any Easter eggs on your planets?

Just a quick question captrobau, are there any Easter eggs on your planets?

I asked that question to CaptRobau a while ago:

I am just wondering here, so I don't mind what the answer is, but will/do moons have any Easter eggs on them?
Maybe? Who knows? I don't know. Do I?

Which implies that there probably are but as far as I know, nothing has been found yet (I think)...

I asked that question to CaptRobau a while ago:

Which implies that there probably are but as far as I know, nothing has been found yet (I think)...

I watched a guy on twitch locate one a while back. I also watched him walk a kerbal up a mountain for like 40 minutes
lajoswinkler found something shiny on Wal but he hasen't went up to it close yet.

There's Easter Eggs o.O

My Twitch stream has just found an addition of a new mission...

I really need to make a list of all the easter eggs I've added, because I have no idea which ones you guys are talking about

Just a head's up, I'll be going on holiday until the 15th starting tomorrow, so don't freak out because none of the devs are around to help you. I'll be back. In the meantime, try to help each other out with OPM stuff as best you can.

Once I get back I'll finish up my work on the atmospheres. The next version of OPM will have them at pretty much stock quality now, thanks to pioneering work by KillAshley/Felger. Hopefully the Kopernicus devs will have released 0.0.7 by then, which should allow 1.7 to finally come out of beta.

I really need to make a list of all the easter eggs I've added, because I have no idea which ones you guys are talking about

Just a head's up, I'll be going on holiday until the 15th starting tomorrow, so don't freak out because none of the devs are around to help you. I'll be back. In the meantime, try to help each other out with OPM stuff as best you can.

Once I get back I'll finish up my work on the atmospheres. The next version of OPM will have them at pretty much stock quality now, thanks to pioneering work by KillAshley/Felger. Hopefully the Kopernicus devs will have released 0.0.7 by then, which should allow 1.7 to finally come out of beta.

Fantastic! Thanks for letting us know beforehand, I look forward to coming out of beta Have a good holiday!

I'll be going on holiday until the 15th starting tomorrow

have fun capt!

One more challenge, inspired by a recent announcement from NASA and friends:

Chaotically tumbling moons?

http://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-s-hubble-finds-pluto-s-moons-tumbling-in-absolute-chaos

animation:

One more challenge, inspired by a recent announcement from NASA and friends:

Chaotically tumbling moons?

http://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-s-hubble-finds-pluto-s-moons-tumbling-in-absolute-chaos

animation:

I'm pretty sure that's not possible given KSPs engine. Giving a planet or moon an kind of spin axis can't really be done let alone a chaotic one.

Just a head's up, I'll be going on holiday until the 15th starting tomorrow, so don't freak out because none of the devs are around to help you. I'll be back. In the meantime, try to help each other out with OPM stuff as best you can.

Have a great holiday!
I exchanged Sarnus for Saturn textures.

I exchanged Sarnus for Saturn textures.

http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot2056_zps8fbh9lgs.png

That looks really good. Nice work.
Kopernicus 0.07 is out! Shame we won't get an update for over a week.

Kopernicus 0.07 is out! Shame we won't get an update for over a week.

You could probably just download the updated plugin and use it.
Forgive me if that was reported before, but entriees for Sarnus and Urlum are swapped in OPM_PlanetShine.cfg and need to be swapped back.

Forgive me if that was reported before, but entriees for Sarnus and Urlum are swapped in OPM_PlanetShine.cfg and need to be swapped back.

Are you sure? they look fine to me
Well, might be that cloud submod messed it, but the thing is - Urlum light was blue while Sarnus was red... I swapped them in .cfg and all went fine - looks good now.

This might be connected:

[ERR 07:18:14.304] [PlanetShine] An exception occured reading CelestialBodyColor node:
CelestialBodyColor
{
        name = Moho
        color = 195,136,84
}

The exception was:
System.ArgumentNullException: Argument cannot be null.
Parameter name: s
  at System.Double.Parse (System.String s, NumberStyles style, IFormatProvider provider) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at System.Single.Parse (System.String s) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at PlanetShine.ConfigManager.LoadBody (.ConfigNode bodySettings) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

...and repeats for every planet.

This might be connected:
[ERR 07:18:14.304] [PlanetShine] An exception occured reading CelestialBodyColor node:
CelestialBodyColor
{
        name = Moho
        color = 195,136,84
}

The exception was:
System.ArgumentNullException: Argument cannot be null.
Parameter name: s
  at System.Double.Parse (System.String s, NumberStyles style, IFormatProvider provider) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at System.Single.Parse (System.String s) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at PlanetShine.ConfigManager.LoadBody (.ConfigNode bodySettings) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

...and repeats for every planet.

I don't get this with OuterPlanet and Planetshine, maybe it's something else...

are you using kopernicus 0.0.7?

-edit-

I think you are using an old version of planetshine, the new planetshine node looks like this:

[B][COLOR=#ff0000]PlanetshineCelestialBody[/COLOR]
[/B]{
    name = Sarnus
    color = 255,175,150
    intensity = 1
    atmosphereAmbient = 1
    groundAmbientOverride = 1
}

yours looks like the old version

[COLOR=#ff0000][B]CelestialBodyColor[/B][/COLOR]
{
        name = Moho
        color = 195,136,84
}

Edited June 7, 2015 by Sigma88

Are these planets integrated into the Community Resource Pack? If not, can the developer make that a thing please? Oh, and compatible with Karbonite/Karbodium as well perhaps? It'd be interesting to make Neidon very rich in atmospheric resources. Seeing as how it has no moons, it would be a challenge to make a base there with a life support mod, but would be very rewarding in terms of resource output.
